knimeNode.name: Probability Distribution Creator
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a Probability Distribution cell out of numeric cells.

fullDescription.intro: Creates a column containing a probability distribution either from numeric or string columns. In case of numeric columns, one or more columns that contain probability values can be picked. The probability values must be non-negative and must sum up to 1. In case of string columns, one single column can be selected. The probability distribution of the string column produces the same results as applying the numeric probability distribution to the output columns of One to Many node applied to the same string column. The node dialog contains three main sections dedicated respectively to numeric columns, string columns and common features for both types.

tab.name: Numeric Columns
tab.option: Move the columns that contain the probability values to the "Include" list.

option.name: Allow probabilities that sum up to 1 imprecisely

tab.option: If enabled, the probabilities must not sum up to 1 precisely. This might be helpful if there are, e.g., some rounding errors in the probability values. A number of decimal digits can be specified that defines the precision as explained below.

Defines the precision that the sum of the probabilities must have by restricting the number of decimal digits that must be precise. The sum is accepted if abs(sum - 1) <= 10^(-precision) , e.g., if the sum is 0.999, it is only accepted with a precision of <=2. The lower the specified number, the higher is the tolerance.

Specify how to treat invalid probabilities. Invalid means, e.g., negative probabilities or probabilities that do not sum up to 1 (with respect to the specified precision). If Fail is selected, the node will fail. Otherwise, the node just gives a warning and puts missing values in the output for the corresponding rows.

tab.name: String Columns
tab.option: A single string column can be picked from the dropdown menu.

tab.name: General
tab.option: Specify the name of the created column.
If selected, the included numeric columns or the picked string column will be removed from the output.

Specify how to treat a missing value in one of the input columns. If Fail is selected, the node will fail. If Ignore is selected, the node just gives a warning and puts missing values in the output for the corresponding rows. If Treat as zero is selected, the missing value will be treated as 0.

ports.inPort: Data with columns containing probability values.
ports.outPort: Input data with an appended column that contains the probability distribution.
